credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for an altar
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. The mensa stands upon a half-circular platform to which steps lead. Four angels stand upon parts of of columns upon high pedestals and support half of a crown with curtains as baldachin. Laterally in front are two statues of angels with candles. Above, at right, is a rough pen sketch with  the idea of having the angels standing immediately upon the pedestals. Written in the upper left corner "No3" corrected to "61".
name: Drawing
